p: On pathogen challenge, plants rapidly produce a high concentration of reactive oxygen species (ROS), known as the “oxidative burst”, which acts both as a direct antimicrobial and in defense signaling [ 111]. In the last 30 years, it has been realized that reactive nitrogen species (RNS) have a similar role, with a nitrosative burst accompanying the oxidative [ 112– 114]. RNS produced during this process include the nitrogen oxide and dioxide radicals (NO and NO 2), the nitric oxide anion (NO −), the nitrosonium ion (NO +), peroxynitrite (OONO −), and nitrothiols (SNOs) [ 115, 116].
